Class Armor

java.lang.Object
Armor
Direct Known Subclasses:
Cone, Flag
public abstract class Armor extends Object
Represents a piece of armor that can be equipped by an entity (e.g., zombies). Armor provides additional health, may affect movement speed, and has a state that can change during gameplay (e.g., breaking, active, destroyed). This class is abstract and intended to be extended by specific armor types (e.g., Conehead, Buckethead).
Since:
2025-07-30

      The current health of the armor.

    • speedBuff

      The speed modifier provided by this armor.

      protected final String NAME
      The name of the armor (e.g., "cone", "flag").

      protected String state
      The current state of the armor. This can change based on gameplay events.

  • Constructor Details

    • Armor

      public Armor(int health, double speedBuff, String name)
      Constructs a new Armor instance with specified health, speed bonus, and name. Initializes the armor's state to "A" and sets it as hittable by default.
      Parameters:
      health - - The initial health value this armor provides or represents.
      speedBuff - - The speed bonus (or penalty) added to the entity wearing this armor.
      name - - The unique name of the armor (e.g., "Cone Armor", "Bucket Armor").

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Retrieves the name of the armor.
      Returns:
      A String representing the name of the armor.

    • getState

      public String getState()
      Retrieves the current state of the armor.
      Returns:
      A String representing the current state.

    • getHealth

      public int getHealth()
      Retrieves the remaining health of the armor.
      Returns:
      An int representing the current health points of the armor.

    • takeDamage

      public void takeDamage(int d)
      Reduces the armor's health by the specified amount of damage. This method directly modifies the armor's health attribute. Subclasses may override or call this method and then trigger updateState().
      Parameters:
      d - - The integer amount of damage to subtract from the armor's health.

    • getSpeedBuff

      public double getSpeedBuff()
      Retrieves the speed bonus (or penalty) provided by the armor. This value affects the movement speed of the entity equipped with this armor.
      Returns:
      A double representing the speed modifier.

    • isHittable

      public boolean isHittable()
      Checks whether the armor can currently be damaged.
      Returns:
      true if the armor is currently susceptible to damage; false otherwise.

    • updateState

      public abstract void updateState()
      Updates the armor's internal state based on its current health, damage taken, or other relevant game logic.
